text: Stentor amethystinus is a single-celled eukaryote. It is often long and is found in freshwater ponds and lakes. Algae live in symbiosis with Stentor amethystinus, providing food for the ciliate, which then protects the algae. Unlike many of its relatives, Stentor amethystinus is red-violet in color, due to the chemical amethystin. ==References== Category:Heterotrichea
title: Stentor amethystinus
